attributes.action: Class gyms as ‘essential’ during periods of lockdown.
attributes.additional_details:
For many people Including myself gyms are the coping mechanism regarding the stability of their mental health.
‘According to the Public Health England's surveillance report, which is based on data from Test and Trace gyms currently stand at 3%, whilst supermarkets are 12%, pubs and bars 10% and secondary schools are 5%.’
Gyms have proven that they can put measures in place to keep us safe so why is it necessarily to close them and sacrifice even more lives in addition to COVID-19 deaths.
attributes.background: Open gyms throughout lockdown with tighter restrictions in place for the sake of mental health.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
